Package game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • game.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Board
extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int[][] board
      2D-array with information about the tiles in the grid
      private int boardNumber
      The Board's number, 1 if local user and 2 if opponent
      private int mousePosX
      The current x-position of the cursor in the Board's grid, -1 if outside
      private int mousePosY
      The current y-position of the cursor in the Board's grid, -1 if outside
      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane parent
      The parent AnchorPane of this Board
      private java.util.ArrayList<Ship> ships
      An ArrayList containing the ships in the board
      static int SIZE
      Width and height of Board image
      static double TILE_SIZE
      The width/height of each tile in the grid
      static int TILES
      Tiles in x and y direction/grid size

        Tiles in x and y direction/grid size

        See Also:

      • mousePosX

        private int mousePosX
        The current x-position of the cursor in the Board's grid, -1 if outside

      • mousePosY

        private int mousePosY
        The current y-position of the cursor in the Board's grid, -1 if outside

      • parent

        private final javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane parent
        The parent AnchorPane of this Board

      • boardNumber

        private final int boardNumber
        The Board's number, 1 if local user and 2 if opponent

      • board

        private int[][] board
        2D-array with information about the tiles in the grid

        -2 = ship, attacked and destroyed -1 = no ship but tile attacked 0 = no ship, not attacked >0 = ship number n in the ArrayList ships, not attacked

      • ships

        private java.util.ArrayList<Ship> ships
        An ArrayList containing the ships in the board

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board​(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane parent,
             double x,
             double y,
             int boardNumber)
        Initiates a new Board object that can be used to display a grid
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent AnchorPane of this object
        x - the x position of this object
        y - the y position of this object
        boardNumber - the number of this board, 1 = local user, 2 = opponent

      • Board

        public Board​(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane parent,
             double x,
             double y)
        constructor for testing purposes. Like the other constructor, but without anchorPane parent
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent AnchorPane of this object
        x - the x position of this object
        y - the y position of this object

    • Method Detail

      • findMousePos

        public void findMousePos​(double x,
                         double y)
        Finds the mouse's position in this Board's grid, and stores it in the class variables mousePosX and mousePosY
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position of the mouse in the board, where x=0 is the upper left corner of the board
        y - the y-position of the mouse in the board, where y=0 is the upper left corner of the board

      • registerShip

        public java.lang.String registerShip​(Ship ship)
        Registers a ship in the class variable "board", which is a 2D-array Sets grid-positions the ship occupy to the ship's index in the ship-array
        Parameters:
        ship - the ship that should be registered
        Returns:
        coordinates in database-form string

      • uploadShipCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ship> uploadShipCoordinates()
        Confirms the placements of the ships by adding them to the board. Uploads their coordinates to the database if no ships are overlapping.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the ships that are overlapping, null if ship placements are valid

      • checkNoShipsOverlap

        private java.util.ArrayList<Ship> checkNoShipsOverlap()
        Checks if any ships are overlapping
        Returns:
        true if no ships are overlapping and false otherwise

      • addToShipArray

        private void addToShipArray​(java.util.ArrayList original,
                            Ship[] extra)
        Adds an Array of ships to an existing ArrayList
        Parameters:
        original - the original ArrayList that's getting more ships
        extra - the new ships that will be added to the ArrayList

      • shipsOverlap

        private Ship[] shipsOverlap​(Ship ship1,
                            Ship ship2)
        Checks if two ships are overlapping on the board
        Parameters:
        ship1 - ship number 1
        ship2 - ship number 2
        Returns:
        true if the ships overlap and false if not

      • registerShipCoordinates

        public void registerShipCoordinates​(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,
                                    int shipIndex)
        Registers ship coordinates from a base x and y, width and height, like the coordinates DatabaseConnector.java gives you
        Parameters:
        x - the ship's upper left corner's x-position in the grid
        y - the ship's upper left corner's y-position in the grid
        width - the width of the ship
        height - the height of the ship
        shipIndex - the ship's index, which is its index in the ship ArrayList

      • registerShipCoordinates

        public void registerShipCoordinates​(Ship ship)

      • addShip

        public boolean addShip​(Ship ship)
        Adds a Ship object to the stage and registers it in the ships array
        Parameters:
        ship - the Ship to add to the ships array
        Returns:
        true if ship could be added and false if there was a problem (for example spaces occupied)

      • addDefaultShips

        public void addDefaultShips​(boolean visible)
        Parameters:
        visible - , sets the visibility of the boat (might not be needed in future versions

      • loadShipsFromDatabase

        public void loadShipsFromDatabase​(int gameid,
                                  int userid)
        Loads ships from a game in the database based on a gameid and userid (of the game's host)
        Parameters:
        gameid - the id of the game in the database
        userid - the id of the host user of the game in the database

      • attack

        public int attack​(int x,
                  int y)
        Attacks a tile on the board's grid
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position on the grid
        y - the y-position on the grid
        Returns:
        -1 if tile already attacked, 0 if no boats, and 1 if boat

      • attack

        public int attack​(int x,
                  int y,
                  boolean upload)
        Attacks a tile on the board's grid
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position on the grid
        y - the y-position on the grid
        upload - true if the attack should be uploaded to the database
        Returns:
        -1 if tile already attacked, 0 if no boats, and 1 if boat

      • addTileColor

        private void addTileColor​(int x,
                          int y,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                          javafx.scene.image.Image image)
        Adds a square to a board that indicates if an attack has missed or hit
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position on the grid
        y - the y-position on the grid
        color - the color of the square, set to null if an image should be used
        image - the square's image, set to null if plain color

      • uploadAttack

        private void uploadAttack​(int x,
                          int y)
        Adds an attack to the upload cache Will be uploaded later by the another thread
        Parameters:
        x - the x-position on the grid
        y - the y-position on the grid

      • setShipsMouseTransparent

        public void setShipsMouseTransparent​(boolean transparent)
        Sets all ships either transparent or visible to mouse events
        Parameters:
        transparent - true if ships should be transparent to mouse events, false if they should be visible

      • shipsRemaining

        public int shipsRemaining()
        Checks how many ships are not destroyed (are alive) and returns the amount
        Returns:
        the amount of ships remaining

      • getMousePosX

        public int getMousePosX()
        Gets the mouse's x-position in the grid
        Returns:
        the class variable mousePosX, the mouse's x-position in the grid

      • getMousePosY

        public int getMousePosY()
        Gets the mouse's y-position in the grid
        Returns:
        the class variable mousePosY, the mouse's y-position in the grid

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the class variable "board" which is a 2D-array with information about ship placement and attacked tiles to a String and returns it
        Overrides:
        toString in class javafx.scene.Node
        Returns:
        the 2D-array class variable "boards" as a String
